channel.title: Unmanaged on A Developer's Experience
channel.description: Recent content in Unmanaged on A Developer's Experience

item.title: Publishing C++/CLI on LeanPub
item.description: I came across LeanPub a few months back. I believe it was through hanselman – blog, video or something. I liked LeanPub instantly because of a couple of reasons.

item.title: An Unfair World of Tuples, Anons., var and auto
item.description:
It all began when I wanted to return more than one value from one of the methods. Although my attempts ended futile, it was fun exploring and musing how things could have been.

There are at least a couple of options to return multiple values from a method:-

  1. return an instance of a class that holds the values
  2. return a tuple

item.title: Crazy Brackets – [](){}();
item.description: What does this cryptic bracket sequence mean? What programming language is it? Is it valid syntax? If there is even a weak chance of this syntax being valid? If so, what does it mean?

item.title: Quiz – Where am I ?
item.description: The question is, in C++, how do detect if an object is allocated on the stack or heap.

item.title: CComPtr Misconception !!!
item.description: This is about a killer bug identified by our chief software engineer in our application. What was devised for ease of use and write smart code ended up in this killer defect due to improper perception. Ok, let us go!
